t: Job 38
The Lord Speaks
Then*p the Lord*s answered Job from the whirlwind. He said:
Who*pn is this who obscures my counsel with*ln ignorant words?
Get*ln ready to answer me like a man; when*ln I question you, you will inform me.
Where*ln were you when I established the earth? Tell*ln me, if you have understanding.
Who*ln fixed its dimensions? Certainly you know! Who*ln stretched a measuring line across it?
What*ln supports its foundations? Or*ln who laid its cornerstone
while*ln the morning stars sang together and*ln all the sons of God shouted for joy?
Who*pn enclosed the sea behind doors when*ln it burst from the womb,
when*ln I made the clouds its garment and*ln total darkness its blanket,
when*ln I determined its boundaries and*ln put its bars and doors in place,
when*ln I declared, “You may come this far, but no farther; your*ln proud waves stop here”?
Have*pn you ever in your life commanded the morning or*ln assigned the dawn its place,
so*ln it may seize the edges of the earth and*ln shake the wicked out of it?
The*ln earth is changed as clay is by a seal; its*ln hills stand out like the folds of a garment.
Light*ln is withheld from the wicked, and*ln the arm raised in violence is broken.
Have*pn you traveled to the sources of the sea or*ln walked in the depths of the oceans?
Have*ln the gates of death been revealed to you? Have*ln you seen the gates of deep darkness?
Have*ln you comprehended the extent of the earth? Tell*ln me, if you know all this.
Where*pn is the road to the home of light? Do*ln you know where darkness lives,
so*ln you can lead it back to its border? Are*ln you familiar with the paths to its home?
Don’t*ln you know? You were already born; you*ln have lived so long!
Have*ln you entered the place where the snow is stored? Or*ln have you seen the storehouses of hail,
which*ln I hold in reserve for times of trouble, for*ln the day of warfare and battle?
What*ln road leads to the place where light is dispersed? Where*ln is the source of the east wind that spreads across the earth?
Who*pn cuts a channel for the flooding rain or*ln clears the way for lightning,
to*ln bring rain on an uninhabited land, on*ln a desert with no human life,
to*ln satisfy the parched wasteland and*ln cause the grass to sprout?
Does*ln the rain have a father? Who*ln fathered the drops of dew?
Whose*ln womb did the ice come from? Who*ln gave birth to the frost of heaven
when*ln water becomes as hard as stone, and*ln the surface of the watery depths is frozen?
Can*pn you fasten the chains of the Pleiades or*ln loosen the belt of Orion?
Can*ln you bring out the constellations in their season and*ln lead the Bear and her cubs?
Do*ln you know the laws of heaven? Can*ln you impose its authority on earth?
Can*ln you command the clouds so*ln that a flood of water covers you?
Can*ln you send out lightning bolts, and they go? Do*ln they report to you, “Here we are”?
Who*pn put wisdom in the heart or*ln gave the mind understanding?
Who*ln has the wisdom to number the clouds? Or*ln who can tilt the water jars of heaven
when*ln the dust hardens like cast metal and*ln the clods of dirt stick together?
Can*pn you hunt prey for a lioness or*ln satisfy the appetite of young lions
when*ln they crouch in their dens and*ln lie in wait within their lairs?
Who*ln provides the raven’s food when*ln its young cry out to God and*ln wander about for lack of food?
